Function Documentation

UPS_EXPORT ups_status_t ups_txn_abort ( ups_txn_t *  txn,
uint32_t  flags 
)

Aborts a Transaction

This function aborts (= cancels) the sequence of Database operations.

Note that the function will fail with UPS_CURSOR_STILL_OPEN if a Cursor was attached to this Transaction (with ups_cursor_create or ups_cursor_clone), and the Cursor was not closed.

Parameters
txnPointer to a Transaction structure
flagsOptional flags for aborting the Transaction, combined with bitwise OR. Unused, set to 0.
Returns
UPS_SUCCESS upon success
UPS_IO_ERROR if writing to the Database file or logfile failed
UPS_CURSOR_STILL_OPEN if there are Cursors attached to this Transaction

Referenced by upscaledb::txn::abort().

UPS_EXPORT ups_status_t ups_txn_begin ( ups_txn_t **  txn,
ups_env_t *  env,
const char *  name,
void *  reserved,
uint32_t  flags 
)

Begins a new Transaction

A Transaction is an atomic sequence of Database operations. With ups_txn_begin such a new sequence is started. To write all operations of this sequence to the Database use ups_txn_commit. To abort and cancel this sequence use ups_txn_abort.

In order to use Transactions, the Environment has to be created or opened with the flag UPS_ENABLE_TRANSACTIONS.

You can create as many Transactions as you want (older versions of upscaledb did not allow to create more than one Transaction in parallel).

Parameters
txnPointer to a pointer of a Transaction structure
envA valid Environment handle
nameAn optional Transaction name
reservedA reserved pointer; always set to NULL
flagsOptional flags for beginning the Transaction, combined with bitwise OR. Possible flags are:
  • UPS_TXN_READ_ONLY This Transaction is read-only and will not modify the Database.
Returns
UPS_SUCCESS upon success
UPS_OUT_OF_MEMORY if memory allocation failed

Referenced by upscaledb::env::begin().

UPS_EXPORT ups_status_t ups_txn_commit ( ups_txn_t *  txn,
uint32_t  flags 
)

Commits a Transaction

This function applies the sequence of Database operations.

Note that the function will fail with UPS_CURSOR_STILL_OPEN if a Cursor was attached to this Transaction (with ups_cursor_create or ups_cursor_clone), and the Cursor was not closed.

Parameters
txnPointer to a Transaction structure
flagsOptional flags for committing the Transaction, combined with bitwise OR. Unused, set to 0.
Returns
UPS_SUCCESS upon success
UPS_IO_ERROR if writing to the file failed
UPS_CURSOR_STILL_OPEN if there are Cursors attached to this Transaction

Referenced by upscaledb::txn::commit().

UPS_EXPORT const char* ups_txn_get_name ( ups_txn_t *  txn)

Retrieves the Transaction name

Returns
NULL if the name was not assigned or if txn is invalid
